Title: Chocolate chunk cookies
Author: Felicity Craft
Intro:
Everyone needs a good chocolate chunk cookie recipe. Here's mine.
Try it out and let me know what you think.
Body:
This recipe eventuated from endless hours of researching the science behind the humble chocolate chip cookie. Brown sugar and melted butter for chew, an extra egg yolk to keep the cookie fudgy, chopping the chocolate into chunks and flakes for little pockets of melted goodness, and on and on and on. Who would have thought it's all so technical?! What makes it even more complex is converting it to being gluten free! Let's just say that there were many many failures in testing.

Yes I know that the ingredient list is rather long but trust me, it is well worth the effort to get the perfect gluten free cookie.

Chilling the dough overnight is another must!
Method: Chop the chocolate into irregular sized chunks and flakes. Set aside for later.
Melt the butter on the stove or microwave, then transfer to a large bowl.
Add both sugars and whisk until completely combined and emulsified with the butter.
Next whisk in the egg, egg yolk and vanilla.
Sift all of the dry ingredients over the bowl, then beat through until no flour specks are left.
Fold through the chocolate. Cover with plastic wrap and set aside to chill in the fridge for 24 hours.
Preheat your oven to 160°C Fan Bake
Scoop you chilled dough onto baking paper lined trays, usually 8 to a tray, and bake for 9-11 minutes

Comments.Comment: Can't wait to try this recipe!
Comments.Name: James

Comments.Comment: YUM! Everyone needs to make these cookies.
